title: They’re Quite Repulsive
body:
Title: They’re Quite Repulsive

Pairing: Tony Stark x Reader

Summary: Normally you’re not a klutz in the lab, but when you’re the only one there at oh-god o’clock at night and a disturbing foe invades your workspace, things happen.

Word Count: 1685

Warning: The phobia is the one of mice/rats, aka musophobia, so if you have it, this is kinda vivid in the reaction

A/N: This is based on an actual phobia I have, don’t @ me bro

“I’ve just got to make this last adjustment-”

“No, Tony.”

“But-”

“You have to get some sleep, honey.”

“You’re not the boss of-”

“FRIDAY, when was the last time he slept?”

“Mr. Stark has not slept in three days.”

Your boyfriend sighed in either irritation or exhaustion (or maybe both) before relenting. With a loving yet victorious smile, you led him to the kitchen where you fixed him breakfast before taking him to bed. “Honey, you need to stop putting so much pressure on yourself. It’s not healthy.”

You could tell he would have made a sarcastic comeback if he had the energy to talk. You took advantage of his vulnerable silence, making your favorite point in times like this. “I know why you stay up, love. But if you want to keep them safe, you can’t be a drooling, sleep-deprived mess.”

Tony makes a small grumbling noise in the back of his throat and you think that it’s meant to be some sort of reply probably laced with profanities. With a slight heave, you got Tony into your shared bed (that he barely used) and slid his jeans off so he’d be comfortable. You got him under the covers and was seconds away from leaving before he let out a small whine, hand extended towards you.

“I would love to sleep right now, but I have a better idea,” The gears turning in his head were probably thinking of something inappropriate, but you quelled those thoughts before they turned to reality. “How about you send me the updates you need to be done on your suit? I can get them done for you and you can get some sleep.”

Tony looked like he was on the edge of accepting your offer, but then he grabbed at you again. “C’mere,” he mumbled. Tony, despite his bad boy persona, was an aggressive cuddler. Most of the time he was the little spoon, and you loved being able to take care of him when he needed a little extra help. You crawled over the bed and into where his arms were waiting, and he closed them around you.

He nuzzled his face into the crook of your neck, taking in the scent of your shampoo. You carded your fingers through his hair slowly in an attempt to soothe him. Expecting that you’d have to do this until he was asleep, you were surprised when he broke the peaceful silence that had cocooned your bedroom.

“Th’ updat’s are in the lab, hon’y,” His speech was slurred (you found it adorable whether he was sleepy or drunk) and it took a second to understand what he had said, but when you did, you felt victorious. “I’ll get them done before I come to bed, sweetie. Just rest for a little while and everything will be okay,” you kiss his temple before crawling out of his arms. Tony reached for your pillow as you walked out of the bedroom, him hugging it like you weren’t going to be back in a few hours.

—————————-

Seconds away from being done, you wipe the sweat from your brow with your free hand. “Dum-E, soldering iron, please,” the robot happily complies, handing you the tool while you try and keep yourself from messing up. You were adding the last adjustment to Tony’s repulsor beams and struggling to make everything as perfect as your boyfriend would. Tony never let anyone work on his suit, so you doing this was a bigger deal than some would realize.

“Steady, steady…” you were talking to yourself in an attempt to help keep your hands from shaking. You knew your way around a lab (you met Tony at MIT long ago), but you had to admit that Tony made his suits so complicated that it wasn’t a walk in the park.

“Finally!” You shout to no one, realizing seconds after you shout that it’s some ungodly hour in the night. Cleaning up, you cross your fingers in the hopes that you didn’t wake anybody up with your exclamation of victory.

Once the lab is somewhat clean, you sit in your previous chair and run a hand down your face. You were exhausted and clueless as to how your boyfriend does this for days on end, wanting nothing more to crawl back into your shared bed and sleep until the afternoon. Your body too fatigued to get up in that moment, you lay your head down in your arms, the worktable becoming your trusty substitute pillow.

You had no idea what time it was when you felt it. It was like a ghost, there one second and gone the next. The short time of its presence and the fact you were in between consciousness and not caused you to doubt whether it even happened, but when it happened again, you knew you weren’t hallucinating the feeling of it on your feet.

You looked down the moment you felt it a second time, catching the culprit in the act. Two beady eyes peered back at you, silently daring you to do something about its presence. Your brain realized with a start what exactly was causing your discomfort and you lost control of your vocal cords.

Your scream ricocheted out of the lab and through the living room as you clambered on top of the work table, your terror awakening your fight-or-flight instinct. FRIDAY had alerted Tony and the others about your increased heart rate and apparent distress (as if your shriek wouldn’t alert them enough) immediately and you cursed. Whoever wasn’t woken up from your scream was for sure going to be awake from FRIDAY’s joyful little wake-up call.

Your boyfriend was the first one to arrive at the scene, fear in his eyes. He most likely heard the scream instead of FRIDAY and you felt guilty for waking him how you did. He absorbed the scene of you cowering on the lab table and frantically searched for the threat before coming up empty.

“Honey, what’s going on?” You stuttered out a broken reply, pointing towards where the rodent scurried to with a shaking finger. You looked horrible; tears were falling from darkened, hollow eyes that desperately needed to rest while frightened sobs escaped your lips. Instead of asking more questions, your loving boyfriend simply walked to you and pulled you into his arms as you shook, unable to speak coherently over your panic.

“It… it t-touched me, T-Tone,” You finally got out. “It c-crawled on mm-my foot!” When you started sobbing more, he pulled you closer and began to run his fingers through your hair to try and calm you down.

More people dashed in within moments, all of them wondering what could have possibly penetrated the Avengers Tower at this hour without tripping any alarms. Without lifting your head from Tony’s chest, you could feel the stares of the rest of the Avengers on you and oh how horrible it made you feel.

For most of everyone in the Tower, sleep was an elusive creature and your scream had chased it away. Your fear began to mesh with guilt and it made the tears on your face fall harder. Tony was shushing you gently as he rocked you back and forth, ignoring the stares and silent questions from his teammates.

“Tony, what’s wrong with her?” Steve had broken the almost-silence with the most obvious question (you were still sobbing so it wasn’t complete silence).

You wanted to answer him, you really did. You wanted to climb off of the table and out of Tony’s arms and calmly explain to them your phobia, but alas, it’s a phobia. It’s presence in your safe haven shook your resolve to the core and kept you from rationally discussing your current state with your friends.

Tony decided to answer for you, sparing you from babbling a reply through your hysteria. “It was a rat and it crawled on her while she was working. Go back to bed, I’ve got her.” They looked worried, but Tony’s hard glare chased them away.

“Tomorrow we can work on setting traps so we can catch it. We’ll get it out of here, don’t worry.” Bucky sympathised, wanting you to feel better.

“We could get a cat. Those things kill rats and stuff, and it’s even cute. Name it Terminator and give it a little Iron Kitten suit.” You laughed a little through the tears, the image of a kitten with its own suit flying around the Tower lightening the mood. Of course that would be the first thing to pop out of Sam’s mouth.

“I-I’m so sorry, guys. I didn’t me-mean to wake everyone,” You stuttered. “It just c-crawled on me an-and I panicked.” Tony brought you a little closer to him while the others were quick to shrug it off like it was no big deal.

“Clint probably would have screamed louder than you did, hon. Don’t feel bad.” Nat got a hard glare from the archer, but it weakened slightly at the sound of your laugh following the comment.

Everyone continued to joke around about the ordeal for a few minutes longer until Tony decided it was time to go to bed. “Alright, this is starting to become a chick-flick, so I’m gonna take her to bed.” You moved to get out of his embrace and onto the floor, but he stopped you. “Nuh-uh, I’m gonna carry you, sweetheart.”

You hear a few “aww” sounds come from your friends and you giggle into Tony’s neck as he lifted you from the work table. “I thought you said this wasn’t gonna be a chick flick!” Clint shouted when Tony had you almost to the bedroom.

You and Tony shared a look for a moment before the two of you sent matching middle fingers toward your friend. The team laughed at the interaction before retreating to their own rooms, eager to catch up on the sleep lost.

Once you and Tony were cuddled in bed, you were finally able to relax. There was nothing that could scare you as long as your loving boyfriend was beside you.

Tony reached for your pillow as you walked out of the bedroom, him hugging it like you weren’t going to be back in a few hours.

—————————-

Seconds away from being done, you wipe the sweat from your brow with your free hand. “Dum-E, soldering iron, please,” the robot happily complies, handing you the tool while you try and keep yourself from messing up. You were adding the last adjustment to Tony’s repulsor beams and struggling to make everything as perfect as your boyfriend would. Tony never let anyone work on his suit, so you doing this was a bigger deal than some would realize.

“Steady, steady…” you were talking to yourself in an attempt to help keep your hands from shaking. You knew your way around a lab (you met Tony at MIT long ago), but you had to admit that Tony made his suits so complicated that it wasn’t a walk in the park.

“Finally!” You shout to no one, realizing seconds after you shout that it’s some ungodly hour in the night. Cleaning up, you cross your fingers in the hopes that you didn’t wake anybody up with your exclamation of victory.

Once the lab is somewhat clean, you sit in your previous chair and run a hand down your face. You were exhausted and clueless as to how your boyfriend does this for days on end, wanting nothing more to crawl back into your shared bed and sleep until the afternoon. Your body too fatigued to get up in that moment, you lay your head down in your arms, the worktable becoming your trusty substitute pillow.

You had no idea what time it was when you felt it. It was like a ghost, there one second and gone the next. The short time of its presence and the fact you were in between consciousness and not caused you to doubt whether it even happened, but when it happened again, you knew you weren’t hallucinating the feeling of it on your feet.

You looked down the moment you felt it a second time, catching the culprit in the act. Two beady eyes peered back at you, silently daring you to do something about its presence. Your brain realized with a start what exactly was causing your discomfort and you lost control of your vocal cords.

Your scream ricocheted out of the lab and through the living room as you clambered on top of the work table, your terror awakening your fight-or-flight instinct. FRIDAY had alerted Tony and the others about your increased heart rate and apparent distress (as if your shriek wouldn’t alert them enough) immediately and you cursed. Whoever wasn’t woken up from your scream was for sure going to be awake from FRIDAY’s joyful little wake-up call.

Your boyfriend was the first one to arrive at the scene, fear in his eyes. He most likely heard the scream instead of FRIDAY and you felt guilty for waking him how you did. He absorbed the scene of you cowering on the lab table and frantically searched for the threat before coming up empty.

“Honey, what’s going on?” You stuttered out a broken reply, pointing towards where the rodent scurried to with a shaking finger. You looked horrible; tears were falling from darkened, hollow eyes that desperately needed to rest while frightened sobs escaped your lips. Instead of asking more questions, your loving boyfriend simply walked to you and pulled you into his arms as you shook, unable to speak coherently over your panic.

“It… it t-touched me, T-Tone,” You finally got out. “It c-crawled on mm-my foot!” When you started sobbing more, he pulled you closer and began to run his fingers through your hair to try and calm you down.

More people dashed in within moments, all of them wondering what could have possibly penetrated the Avengers Tower at this hour without tripping any alarms. Without lifting your head from Tony’s chest, you could feel the stares of the rest of the Avengers on you and oh how horrible it made you feel.

For most of everyone in the Tower, sleep was an elusive creature and your scream had chased it away. Your fear began to mesh with guilt and it made the tears on your face fall harder. Tony was shushing you gently as he rocked you back and forth, ignoring the stares and silent questions from his teammates.

“Tony, what’s wrong with her?” Steve had broken the almost-silence with the most obvious question (you were still sobbing so it wasn’t complete silence).

You wanted to answer him, you really did. You wanted to climb off of the table and out of Tony’s arms and calmly explain to them your phobia, but alas, it’s a phobia. It’s presence in your safe haven shook your resolve to the core and kept you from rationally discussing your current state with your friends.

Tony decided to answer for you, sparing you from babbling a reply through your hysteria. “It was a rat and it crawled on her while she was working. Go back to bed, I’ve got her.” They looked worried, but Tony’s hard glare chased them away.

“Tomorrow we can work on setting traps so we can catch it. We’ll get it out of here, don’t worry.” Bucky sympathised, wanting you to feel better.

“We could get a cat. Those things kill rats and stuff, and it’s even cute. Name it Terminator and give it a little Iron Kitten suit.” You laughed a little through the tears, the image of a kitten with its own suit flying around the Tower lightening the mood. Of course that would be the first thing to pop out of Sam’s mouth.

“I-I’m so sorry, guys. I didn’t me-mean to wake everyone,” You stuttered. “It just c-crawled on me an-and I panicked.” Tony brought you a little closer to him while the others were quick to shrug it off like it was no big deal.

“Clint probably would have screamed louder than you did, hon. Don’t feel bad.” Nat got a hard glare from the archer, but it weakened slightly at the sound of your laugh following the comment.

Everyone continued to joke around about the ordeal for a few minutes longer until Tony decided it was time to go to bed. “Alright, this is starting to become a chick-flick, so I’m gonna take her to bed.” You moved to get out of his embrace and onto the floor, but he stopped you. “Nuh-uh, I’m gonna carry you, sweetheart.”

You hear a few “aww” sounds come from your friends and you giggle into Tony’s neck as he lifted you from the work table. “I thought you said this wasn’t gonna be a chick flick!” Clint shouted when Tony had you almost to the bedroom.

You and Tony shared a look for a moment before the two of you sent matching middle fingers toward your friend. The team laughed at the interaction before retreating to their own rooms, eager to catch up on the sleep lost.

Once you and Tony were cuddled in bed, you were finally able to relax. There was nothing that could scare you as long as your loving boyfriend was beside you.

Title: They’re Quite Repulsive

Pairing: Tony Stark x Reader

Summary: Normally you’re not a klutz in the lab, but when you’re the only one there at oh-god o’clock at night and a disturbing foe invades your workspace, things happen.

Word Count: 1685

Warning: The phobia is the one of mice/rats, aka musophobia, so if you have it, this is kinda vivid in the reaction

A/N: This is based on an actual phobia I have, don’t @ me bro

title: Superfamily au - Breakfast
body:
Tony: he has two pancakes in his plate and a lot of coffee. Like, he has more deciliters of coffee in his mug than grams of pancakes, even though they are very big. He drinks Italian espresso only when he has to stay awake for more than thirty hours. And he spends his breakfast in a half-asleep status, with his head resting on Steve’s shoulder, telling him that he isn’t hungry and he has to go back to the workshop, but he knows that Steve loves just too much to feed him, so he can stays until Peter will leave for school. Sometimes he arrives in the kitchen after a glorious night with Steve that they spent in their bed (after the workshop couch, and a wall, and the shower… fortunately neither of them need a lot of sleep) Other times, he arrives in the kitchen directly from the workshop and then Steve consumes his last strengths so he has to sleep for at least a couple of hours. Not that he can complain about that. Maybe Peter would, if he knows that his Pop cannot resist to bend Tony over the nearest surfaces. Repeatedly.

Steve: he is the one who makes breakfast, right after his morning run. He makes at least five pancakes for himself with the bigger pan they have and sometimes he looks embarrassed, because he is still surprise about how much he can eat. So he try to have just enough food and orange juice to make him look like he isn’t a bottomless pit. And then he will have one or two more snacks before lunch, maybe some fruits so he can share them with Tony. Steve spends the morning watching his husband’s fluffy bed-hair with heart-shaped eyes, and making Peter feels uncomfortable because of the lovely atmosphere. He put the mug with hot coffee right in the genius’ hands when he shows up and then he feed him, because taking care of his family is the most beautiful thing in the world. Yes, at the same level of having sex with you, Tony. He corrects himself every time he says something like that, but only after the adorable and fake-offended pout shows up on Tony’s face.

Peter: he is not only a mutant boy with a very fast metabolism, due to his new DNA, he is also a teen, so he needs like twelve or thirteen pancakes with a cascade of maple syrup, some fruits, hot milk and maybe also some leftovers. Sometimes his parents thinks he is disgusting, because, Pete, do you really need to put honey on that caviar sandwhich? And, Tony, why most of your leftovers are covered with gold leaf and have expensive ingredients? Usually the answer is ‘m rich and like the color, anyway most of the time Peter simply ignores them, because he is soo hungry. During breakfast, he is the one who talks the most, also to keep him distracted from his parents’ lovey-dovey acts. They use nicknames like ‘sweetheart’ and ‘love’ (from Steve) or ‘gorgeous’ and ‘captain eye candy’ (from Tony) and kiss a lot, anything sloppy, actually they are really sweet and he is very lucky because he also likes to receive morning kisses, but he is also a teen, don’t forget that. Then, before leaving for school, he opens some of his projects on the holograms that can appear anywhere in the new Avengers Facility and he shows his progress to both Steve and Tony, receiving very useful advices from his dad that he will refine at school.

summary:
Sometimes I think about Tony and Peter’s conversation during Homecoming. You know the disappointed!Tony one. 
Peter Parker: I...
body:
Sometimes I think about Tony and Peter’s conversation during Homecoming. You know the disappointed!Tony one.

Peter Parker: I just wanted to be like you.

Tony Stark: And I wanted you to be better.

Like that interaction breaks my damn heart.

On one hand, my heart breaks for Peter Parker. Who desperately wants to prove himself and make Tony proud. Peter Benjamin Parker, who after being through so damn much in his life at such a young age, wants nothing more than to be a hero. And not just any hero. No, he wants to be a hero like Tony Stark. Cause I imagine, Peter must have read what Tony went through right? From graduating MIT at 17 to losing his parents to being kidnapped by a terrorist group to saving the world everyday as Iron-Man. Can you imagine 2010 Peter Parker sitting in his living room in Queens excited to go to the Stark Expo? Can you imagine how Peter must have felt when Tony Stark saved his life that night and well technically gave [Peter] the credit for it and kinda made him a hero that night? So, Peter sees Tony as this amazing guy. As the man who invented all these cool robots and revolutionized clean energy. As the man who, despite having been through so much loss and pain, still puts others life before his own. And that’s why Peter desperately wants to be a hero like Tony Stark. And my heart breaks for Peter because I imagine he must have felt like he failed yet another person in his life at that moment.

But on the other hand, my heart also breaks for Tony Stark. Who instead of taking Peter Parker wanting to be like him as a compliment immediately replies with “I wanted you to be better.” Because to Tony, Peter wanting to be like him?? “Why would he want to be like me?” Tony thinks to himself as he remembers his “laundry list of character defects.” He thinks back to all of his self-destructive tendencies and all the times when the things that went wrong were his fault (even though it wasn’t always, he felt that he still deserved all the pain he got). He recalls the nights when he couldn’t sleep because the images of an alien army made him feel sick to his stomach. Or how whenever he thinks about his friends and loved ones, a pain shoots up his left arm at the possibility that he can’t save them. And Tony thinks, “Any one but me, kid. Please don’t be like me. I wouldn’t want you to go through this.” Because Tony only sees himself as a screw up, the man who’s legacy it was to kill the Avengers, who technically wasn’t even considered qualified to be an Avenger (and he knows how much Peter wants to be an Avenger), the man who’s broken beyond repair and hurts everyone around him. See, Peter Parker had thought about being like Tony Stark since before 2010. But what absolutely shatters my heart is that when Tony Stark met Peter Parker and decided to provide some sort of support, what went through Tony’s head was “this kid is going to be so much better than me.”

And that is why I cry every time I see that scene.

reblog.comment:
Sometimes I think about Tony and Peter’s conversation during Homecoming. You know the disappointed!Tony one.

Peter Parker: I just wanted to be like you.

Tony Stark: And I wanted you to be better.

Like that interaction breaks my damn heart.

On one hand, my heart breaks for Peter Parker. Who desperately wants to prove himself and make Tony proud. Peter Benjamin Parker, who after being through so damn much in his life at such a young age, wants nothing more than to be a hero. And not just any hero. No, he wants to be a hero like Tony Stark. Cause I imagine, Peter must have read what Tony went through right? From graduating MIT at 17 to losing his parents to being kidnapped by a terrorist group to saving the world everyday as Iron-Man. Can you imagine 2010 Peter Parker sitting in his living room in Queens excited to go to the Stark Expo? Can you imagine how Peter must have felt when Tony Stark saved his life that night and well technically gave [Peter] the credit for it and kinda made him a hero that night? So, Peter sees Tony as this amazing guy. As the man who invented all these cool robots and revolutionized clean energy. As the man who, despite having been through so much loss and pain, still puts others life before his own. And that’s why Peter desperately wants to be a hero like Tony Stark. And my heart breaks for Peter because I imagine he must have felt like he failed yet another person in his life at that moment.

But on the other hand, my heart also breaks for Tony Stark. Who instead of taking Peter Parker wanting to be like him as a compliment immediately replies with “I wanted you to be better.” Because to Tony, Peter wanting to be like him?? “Why would he want to be like me?” Tony thinks to himself as he remembers his “laundry list of character defects.” He thinks back to all of his self-destructive tendencies and all the times when the things that went wrong were his fault (even though it wasn’t always, he felt that he still deserved all the pain he got). He recalls the nights when he couldn’t sleep because the images of an alien army made him feel sick to his stomach. Or how whenever he thinks about his friends and loved ones, a pain shoots up his left arm at the possibility that he can’t save them. And Tony thinks, “Any one but me, kid. Please don’t be like me. I wouldn’t want you to go through this.” Because Tony only sees himself as a screw up, the man who’s legacy it was to kill the Avengers, who technically wasn’t even considered qualified to be an Avenger (and he knows how much Peter wants to be an Avenger), the man who’s broken beyond repair and hurts everyone around him. See, Peter Parker had thought about being like Tony Stark since before 2010. But what absolutely shatters my heart is that when Tony Stark met Peter Parker and decided to provide some sort of support, what went through Tony’s head was “this kid is going to be so much better than me.”

And that is why I cry every time I see that scene.

Just One Word

chapter two

other parts: chapter one

summary: Tony’s POV on the first day of junior year

words: 1.5k

comments: this is basically exposition part 2. We’re seeing a merge from last chapter through Tony’s head. the exposition is officially OVER and chapter three will pick up on some good stuff! also the moodboard is done by the amazingly talented @fratboievans thank you sm

warnings: just some good old fashioned kissing, nothing too serious and I think there’s like one swear word.

“So, I missed you last week, how was Brooklyn?” Emma asked smirking as she weaved her fingers through her boyfriend’s fingers.

“I was a taxi drive away, it’s not like I went to Germany.” Tony said raising his eyebrows. Sure she was cute, and genuinely one of the nicest girls he had ever met, but Tony didn’t like the way she depended on his attention and company so much. Not that Tony didn’t love the attention, it was just too much at times.

“Are you going to Germany?” she asked hesitantly.

“Emma, we’re going to school, I’m not going anywhere without you.” Tony wrapped his arm around Emma’s shoulder, reassuring her. She nuzzled her head in his neck and they continued their walk to school.

It went on with a steady silence. They were close to each other, but didn’t say anything. Emma’s mind probably wondering about what they relatively new couple were going to do in the oncoming autumn. Halloween and holiday season was soon, after all. All Tony could think about, though, was football season starting and what his father was going to say about him spending all his time after school on that.

As they kept walking, his thoughts continued to drift. Up ahead he could see a tall blonde girl walking ahead of them. “Who is that?” Tony asked Emma, immediately regretting it because he knew Emma would get jealous.

“Pepper Potts, we’re co-presidents of the Business club. You don’t know who she is? She’s the one who hosts all the pep rallies!”

“I don’t pay attention, I’m always in the locker rooms waiting for them to call the football team,” Tony countered.

“Waiting for her to call the football team,” Emma nudged Tony. He simply rolled his eyes and tightened his grip on her. They continued to walk in silence, which Tony preferred.

“Tony, can’t we take our time, spend time with each other?” Emma begged. Tony glanced at her with a raised eyebrow and Emma smiled. She began playfully skipping around Tony, grabbing his hand. She kissed his cheek and stopped him in his tracks.

“Hm, maybe we could take a break. Those trees over there look pretty comfy.” Tony reached his other hand down and grabbed Emma’s open hand. They took a sharp right and turned into a small alcove of trees.

Tony leaned his back against the tree and put his hands out reaching for Emma. Once he could grasp her, he pulled her hips against his and spread his hands to her back. She leaned in slowly until her lips brushed against his.

At first, they did nothing. He opened his mouth and slowly she put her hands on his shoulders. His hands lowered below her waist and his tongue found her bottom lip. She leaned into him, but then quickly took a step back breaking their contact.

“Tony, that’s too far.” She looked down at the floor, embarrassed.

“Don’t worry about it,” he said grabbing her hand and pulling her back towards the path up to school. “No pressure,” he smiled. He wrapped his hand around her shoulder and they finished their walk to high school in silence.

Tony opened the door for Emma and followed her in. Immediately, they were bombarded by a group of guys in blue and yellow jerseys. Screaming ensued and chants of “Tony” began.

Emma took a step back from Tony, uncomfortable from the lack of personal space. She let the football team do their thing. Watching as they huddled around Tony and wrapped their arms around each other.

“This year is our year!” Tony yelled, exciting the boys surrounding him. The football team was the royal court of high school, and Tony was the king. Tony knew it too. Every girl wanted to be with him and every guy wanted to be him. 

“Bruce, see you didn’t do anything over summer,” Tony said slapping the shorter boy’s stomach.

The crowd dissipated and Tony, Bruce, and Emma began their walk to their classes. “Har har, I’ve been playing all summer with my brothers. What have you been doing? Helping your dad fight aliens or some shit?”

“Boy did I miss you,” Tony grinned, wrapping his arm around Bruce’s neck and giving him an affectionate noogie. “We all in homeroom together?” He asked letting go of Bruce and continuing the walk.

Emma and Bruce pulled out their phones to look at their schedules.

“I have Ms. Danvers,” Bruce said sliding his phone back in his pocket.

“Same!” Emma said excitedly, reaching over Tony to give Bruce a high-five. “What about you, Tony?”

“Mr. Lang,” he sighed, “this blows!” Tony said stopping in front of a door marked Scott Lang. “Well, I guess I’ll… see you at lunch?” He leaned forward and gave Emma a quick peck.

“Ew, ew, ew, okay lovebirds you’ll see each other literally in 3 hours, give it a rest,” Bruce said waving his hand. He jokingly wrapped his arm around Emma’s shoulder and started walking her towards their own homeroom a few doors down. “I’ll take care of her, no worries Stark.”

Tony shook his head listening to Emma’s laugh as they disappeared down the hallway. He turned his head to face the door and opened it. Inside were two people: Jane Foster and Pepper Potts. He quietly scanned the room for his seat but to no avail, until he heard Jane say, “Right here, Tony,” as she motioned towards the seat in a theatrical manner.

“Thanks, Jane,” he replied nodding his head in a “bro” sort of way. Jane headed back toward her seat as Tony stepped into his and sat down. He looked to his left. Pepper was seated with perfect posture already writing diligently on what looked to be like homework. “Hi,” he said, bending down to get a look at her face, and ultimately trying to start some conversation.

Pepper jerked her head up. She looked dead in Tony’s eyes for a few seconds before looking at his feet. “Hi, I’m, um, I’m Pepper.”

“I know,” he responded. Her eyes shot back up at Tony’s. The most beautiful shade of blue he had ever seen. Noticing the dark teal around her iris, he smiled. “I’m Tony.”

“Yes, I know, your father owns basically everything in this city.” She laughed as she turned back to her work. He had never heard a laugh that made his teeth show under a smile so quickly.

“You have a point,” he said swiveling his legs under the desk. He pulled out a binder from his perpetually opened backpack saying, “are you working on homework or…?”

“Yeah I’m doing tutor work for Ms. Danvers for calculus and she gave me the work for this week a few days ago, so I thought I’d get a head start so I know what I’m doing.” She not once looked up at Tony and continued scribbling numbers and symbols on her paper.

“Wow, impressive,” Tony laughed. “I might need to ask for your help on some calculus too if it comes down to it.” He leaned back and rested his hands on his head. He glanced over at Pepper hoping for some sort of eye contact.

At those words, though, Pepper immediately looked at Tony with a small half-smile. “Sure, um, abso-,” she stopped herself from sounding too eager. “That’d be okay.”

“Cool,” he said coming back from his resting position. Pepper was… intriguing to Tony. He’d never met a girl who didn’t try and be a part of his life immediately. He didn’t see it as Pepper playing ‘hard to get’, rather she was completely doing her own thing and she was proud of it.

Tony sat there in silence, thinking about this fascinating girl next to him. She seemed so independent yet kind-hearted. He wanted to be a part of her life, in some way, but knew because of Emma he would have trouble.

“So, Pepper,” he began as he opened his binder. Pepper immediately swung around to look at him, though, he saw Jane walking towards the couple. He shuffled his papers and stopped talking, but he was preparing to covertly eavesdrop on the oncoming conversation between Jane and Pepper.

“So tonight, around 7? Stay up till midnight so we can celebrate!” He heard Jane say with a sing-song voice, grabbing Pepper’s hands. Pepper’s attention was completely diverted from Tony’s as he continued to listen.

“Yes, but don’t invite anyone you know I wouldn’t want,” Pepper retaliated.

“So Tony, do you want to come to Pepper’s sleepover tonight? It’s her seventeenth birthday!” Jane leaned down and rested her chin on Pepper’s shoulder. “She’d love it if you could come.

Tony saw Pepper pinch Jane’s arm. “Well, I mean, I wouldn’t want to intrude.”

“No, no,” Jane said, “Pepper would love it, wouldn’t you.”

“Yeah, if you want, Tony.” Pepper said looking Tony dead in the eyes.

“Um, okay. I’ll see if I can swing by after practice tonight.” Tony said nodding.

“Great, there’s going to be a ton of people. Can’t wait!” Jane said hugging Pepper. She looked Tony deep in the eyes and then walked off back at her seat as Mr. Lang walked into the room. Tall, built, and always wearing some sort of T-shirt.

“Can’t wait, Pepper.” Tony said looking back at the front of the class. More people had flooded into the room, yet Tony hadn’t noticed. The clock almost said 8:30, so Tony slid his phone away and got a few pencils out. 11 hours till Pepper’s party.

“Mr. Lang,” he sighed, “this blows!” Tony said stopping in front of a door marked Scott Lang. “Well, I guess I’ll… see you at lunch?” He leaned forward and gave Emma a quick peck.

“Ew, ew, ew, okay lovebirds you’ll see each other literally in 3 hours, give it a rest,” Bruce said waving his hand. He jokingly wrapped his arm around Emma’s shoulder and started walking her towards their own homeroom a few doors down. “I’ll take care of her, no worries Stark.”

Tony shook his head listening to Emma’s laugh as they disappeared down the hallway. He turned his head to face the door and opened it. Inside were two people: Jane Foster and Pepper Potts. He quietly scanned the room for his seat but to no avail, until he heard Jane say, “Right here, Tony,” as she motioned towards the seat in a theatrical manner.

“Thanks, Jane,” he replied nodding his head in a “bro” sort of way. Jane headed back toward her seat as Tony stepped into his and sat down. He looked to his left. Pepper was seated with perfect posture already writing diligently on what looked to be like homework. “Hi,” he said, bending down to get a look at her face, and ultimately trying to start some conversation.

Pepper jerked her head up. She looked dead in Tony’s eyes for a few seconds before looking at his feet. “Hi, I’m, um, I’m Pepper.”

“I know,” he responded. Her eyes shot back up at Tony’s. The most beautiful shade of blue he had ever seen. Noticing the dark teal around her iris, he smiled. “I’m Tony.”

“Yes, I know, your father owns basically everything in this city.” She laughed as she turned back to her work. He had never heard a laugh that made his teeth show under a smile so quickly.

“You have a point,” he said swiveling his legs under the desk. He pulled out a binder from his perpetually opened backpack saying, “are you working on homework or…?”

“Yeah I’m doing tutor work for Ms. Danvers for calculus and she gave me the work for this week a few days ago, so I thought I’d get a head start so I know what I’m doing.” She not once looked up at Tony and continued scribbling numbers and symbols on her paper.

“Wow, impressive,” Tony laughed. “I might need to ask for your help on some calculus too if it comes down to it.” He leaned back and rested his hands on his head. He glanced over at Pepper hoping for some sort of eye contact.

At those words, though, Pepper immediately looked at Tony with a small half-smile. “Sure, um, abso-,” she stopped herself from sounding too eager. “That’d be okay.”

“Cool,” he said coming back from his resting position. Pepper was… intriguing to Tony. He’d never met a girl who didn’t try and be a part of his life immediately. He didn’t see it as Pepper playing ‘hard to get’, rather she was completely doing her own thing and she was proud of it.

Tony sat there in silence, thinking about this fascinating girl next to him. She seemed so independent yet kind-hearted. He wanted to be a part of her life, in some way, but knew because of Emma he would have trouble.

“So, Pepper,” he began as he opened his binder. Pepper immediately swung around to look at him, though, he saw Jane walking towards the couple. He shuffled his papers and stopped talking, but he was preparing to covertly eavesdrop on the oncoming conversation between Jane and Pepper.

“So tonight, around 7? Stay up till midnight so we can celebrate!” He heard Jane say with a sing-song voice, grabbing Pepper’s hands. Pepper’s attention was completely diverted from Tony’s as he continued to listen.

“Yes, but don’t invite anyone you know I wouldn’t want,” Pepper retaliated.

“So Tony, do you want to come to Pepper’s sleepover tonight? It’s her seventeenth birthday!” Jane leaned down and rested her chin on Pepper’s shoulder. “She’d love it if you could come.

Tony saw Pepper pinch Jane’s arm. “Well, I mean, I wouldn’t want to intrude.”

“No, no,” Jane said, “Pepper would love it, wouldn’t you.”

“Yeah, if you want, Tony.” Pepper said looking Tony dead in the eyes.

“Um, okay. I’ll see if I can swing by after practice tonight.” Tony said nodding.

“Great, there’s going to be a ton of people. Can’t wait!” Jane said hugging Pepper. She looked Tony deep in the eyes and then walked off back at her seat as Mr. Lang walked into the room. Tall, built, and always wearing some sort of T-shirt.

“Can’t wait, Pepper.” Tony said looking back at the front of the class. More people had flooded into the room, yet Tony hadn’t noticed. The clock almost said 8:30, so Tony slid his phone away and got a few pencils out. 11 hours till Pepper’s party.

body:
Requested by someone anonym (sorry if I failed you)

I actually wanted to post this tomorrow but then I was like… Nah…screw it

Warnings for this chapter:

rape kink

Dark shit

Maybe some dirty talk idk yet. 

I will definitely be to bad for this

Peter is at least over 18 in every of my Oneshots.

All in all i’m just sorry for this.

Short introduction why Peter wears what he wears:

Sooo where I live there is a week were the students of the graduation class dress up, everyday there is a new theme for the students (my favorite is always gender-swap or pyjama day)

It’s called “motto-woche” I guess in English it’s theme-week or something like that… Eh whatever i’m talking to much,  the point is,  I don’t know if American schools have something like that too but… In this case Peters school has something like that and the theme of the day is “Japanese day”

I’m going to fail this so badly, i’m already sorry. And don’t you dare reading this Mareike! Yeah! I’m talking to you!

Pov. Tony (because I still like his pov.)

So, the kids already ten minutes late, I hope he is fine, he’s never to late for his Intership,  even when he is sick. I need to send him home sometimes when he doesn’t feel well. (or maybe he doesn’t feel so good. TOO SOON FOR MYSELF)

Then I heard the elevator doors open

“Mr. Stark, i’m Soooo sorry. I’m late”

(at this point my inspiration was completely down so I had to read tons of Tumblr Oneshots.  Again.)

“oh, hey kid. No problem, there is nothing much to do to…day… What is that?” when I looked up the kid he ehm… He wears something… for him Unlikely? 

Peter looked at me at me “a smoothie” he holds the cup up happily,  I actually didn’t recognized that until now. “n-no, I mean what are you wearing." 

"Oh, that.. We..eh.. We got that thing in school at the moment… It’s like a special day with a theme and everybody… Dressed up like… This theme… Ehm… You understand, right?” He Tried to reason himself, even though he’s pretty bad at hidding that this is embarrassing for him.

“a-and the theme today was ‘Japanese day’ so Uhm… I got this…  School uniform from… Amazon" 

Oh god, this is hot.  Really,  don’t blame me please,  I can’t do anything against natural instincts. Okey, maybe it’s the Alcohol too, yeah I drunk a little bit… But just a few glasses maybe two ore… Six.

"don’t be shy, little one. I like it” I noticed that my voice turned deep at the end,  it wasn’t on purpose,  I swear, it just happened.

The kid turned red and hell… I like this expression alot. If he goes any further,  i’m going to lose it, and I can’t have that on my list. It would definitely be a sin but… I’m atheist so… Actually who, cares? I’m going to hell anyways.

“Hey kid, come over here.” I said when I turned around to the table “anything to do today Mr. Stark?” he walked over and stand next to me.

The boy looked at me at with this damn innocent expression. This is definitely not the best to do but I took another sip of my scotch. 

“Mr. Stark?” he asked again

“Friday, turn off the lab cameras and lock the elevator doors” she doesn’t response but I know she did it.

I looked at Peter whos looking back at me with confusion. Without warning I grabbed his wrist and pushed him against the work bench. I put my hands on the Table, caging the boy. “I know even with decathlon training you would have had enough time to change clothes before getting here. So what are you up to?”

He looked at me in shock, like I found out his biggest secret,  well maybe I did. “I..I don’t know wha-” I cut him off with a rough kiss. He nearly immediately kissed back.

I knew it, behind this innocent face he is such a little slut.

Before he realized I broke the kiss, turned him around and bent him over the workbench. In the next moment some nano-bots pinned his arms and wrists down, he could barely move and there is no chance he could get away like this.

“Mr. Stark,  what are you doing?” He cried out.

I smirked at the sight infront of me “oh, you were a bad boy by turning me on that much. And bad boys become punishments." 

"w-what are you going to do?”

“oh, glad that you asked” I leaned over to whisper in his ear “i’m going to wreck you, fuck you raw right here on the, you will will beg me to stop but I wont. I’ll continue until you pass out. But I know you will love every moment of it because you are a fucking slut. My little personal whore”

He whimpered under me when I pushed his pants and boxers down “Mr. Stark I-”

I slapped his ass hardly “call me sir when i’m using you slut”

“i’m Sorry s-sir”

“better be babyboy. I won’t forgive you a second time.”

I shoved two fingers into the boy, he yelped in pain. My other Handy is placed on his lower back.

“we’re going to have a lot fun together  Boy…" 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

BOOM REALLY BAD CUT HERE! 

MUHAHAHA! but I think you can all image what happens after this.

Btw. I’m sorry. Really really sorry, i’m always afraid what you guys would think of me if I do something you don’t like or  something wrong.
